sections.title: Computer Science Basics
sections.description: Algorithms, data structures, and programming logic

questions.text: What is the worst-case time complexity of searching for an element in an unsorted singly linked list of length n?
questions.explanation: You may need to scan all n nodes in the worst case.

questions.text: Which of the following sorting algorithms is stable in its typical implementation?
questions.explanation: MergeSort preserves the order of equal keys in standard implementations.

questions.text: For a binary search on a sorted array of size n, the worst-case time complexity is:
questions.explanation: Each comparison halves the search space.

questions.text: Consider the pseudocode: FOR i = 1..n: FOR j = 1..i: do_constant_work(). The total time is:
A queue data structure supports which access discipline?
In a hash table with chaining and load factor α, the expected time of a successful search is:
questions.explanation: Expected list length is proportional to the load factor α.

questions.text: A complete binary tree of height h has how many nodes (approximately)?
questions.explanation: Complete binary trees grow exponentially with height: about 2^{h+1}-1 nodes.

questions.text: Depth-First Search (DFS) on a graph with V vertices and E edges runs in:
questions.explanation: Each vertex and edge is explored at most a constant number of times.

questions.text: Which statement about Binary Search Trees (BST) is TRUE?
options: A) In-order traversal yields a reverse-sorted sequence
B) In-order traversal yields a sorted sequence
C) Pre-order traversal yields a sorted sequence
D) Level-order traversal yields a sorted sequence
questions.explanation: In-order traversal of a BST visits keys in ascending order.

questions.text: Which of the following is typically in-place?
questions.explanation: QuickSort partitions the array in place; MergeSort/radix/counting usually need extra space.

questions.text: Which WHILE loop is equivalent to the FOR loop: for(i=0; i<n; i++){ body }?
questions.explanation: Initialize i=0, run while i<n, and increment i inside the loop body.

questions.text: Given the recurrence T(n)=2T(n/2)+n, what is T(n)?
questions.explanation: By Master Theorem (a=2, b=2, f(n)=n), T(n)=Θ(n log n).

questions.text: In a singly linked list, what is the time to insert a new node AFTER a given node (pointer provided)?
questions.explanation: With a direct pointer to the predecessor, insertion is constant time.

questions.text: Dynamic programming is most appropriate when a problem exhibits:
options: B) Optimal substructure and overlapping subproblems
D) Exponential state space with no reuse
questions.explanation: DP leverages optimal substructure and repeated subproblems.

questions.text: What is the space complexity of recursive binary search on an array (excluding input storage)?
questions.explanation: The recursion depth is O(log n); each call adds a constant frame.
